snippet: At stake in a legal battle is whether Paul Thurmond, son of Strom Thurmond, a United States senator for 48 years, will be able to run for a state legislative seat in November.
abstract: Panel of three federal judges in Charleston, South Carolina, will hear appeal by South Carolina Democrats who say earlier rulings keeping Paul Thurmond, son of Strom Thurmond, on the ballot for a state legislative seat were flawed.
lead_paragraph: At stake in a legal battle is whether Paul Thurmond, son of Strom Thurmond, a United States senator for 48 years, will be able to run for a state legislative seat in November.

headline.seo: In South Carolina, Paul Thurmond’s Candidacy Faces Challenge
headline.main: New Rule Leads to Old School Politics in South Carolina, Critics Say
headline.print_headline: New Rule Leads to Old School Politics in South Carolina, Critics Say
